required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Panomic Approach to Immune-Connected Assays in Small Cell Lung Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Panomic Approach to Immune-Connected Assays in Small Cell Lung Cancer

lead_sponsor.agency: Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS

clinical_study.source: Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS

brief_summary.textblock:
The scope of the PICASSO project is to apply an innovative patient-based pan-omic approach to immune-assays, that will include multi-omics tumour characterization (genome, proteome, transcriptome), blood immune-cells and cytokine profiling, serological screening for paraneoplastic autoantibodies, clinical and metabolic measurements.
The PICASSO project is aimed to validate in real world population the predictive role of SCLC transcriptomic classification (particularly, I-SCLC subtype) and to explore correlations with dynamic changes in peripheral blood immunity. Additionally, investigators expected to validate the predictive/prognostic role of emerging new variables, including metabolic-induced meta-inflammation alterations and subclinical auto-immunity.

primary_outcome.description: Time from treatment start until the date of first documented progression or date of death from any cause, whichever came first, assessed up to 60 months
Time from treatment start to the date of death from any cause, assessed up to 60 months

study_pop.textblock: ES SCLC patients treated with first line chemo-immunotherapy (EP-IO

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. histologically- or cytologically-documented extensive-stage SCLC
2. to have received upfront treatment with Cisplatin/Carboplatin, etoposide and anti PD1/PD-L1 inhibitors
3. No evidence of brain metastases at diagnosis
4. ECOG PS 0-2
5. adult patients (aged â‰¥ 18 years) at diagnosis;
6. signing of informed consent approved by the local Ethic Committee
Exclusion Criteria:
- none

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS
